channel.title: Sports Blog on Jordan Saadeh Sports Analytics Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Sports Blog on Jordan Saadeh Sports Analytics Blog

item.title: Evaluating the Minnesota Vikings 2021 NFL Draft
item.description: Going into the 2021 NFL Draft the Minnesota Vikings were looking to draft a handful of rookies who can eventually play a major role on the team. General Manager of the Minnesota Vikings and Head Coach Mike Zimmer did just that on draft night, with drafting a total of eleven players. GM Rick Spielman shocked all Vikings fans in the first round of the draft by trading back picks from the 14th overall pick to the 23rd overall pick.

item.title: Evaluating the Minnesots Vikings 2021 Draft

item.title: NFL Plans on Airing Thursday Night Football on Amazon Prime Video
item.description: On Monday, the National Football League announced that Thursday Night Football, Primetimeâ€™s second most watched show that has been previously aired on Fox News will now be available only on Amazon Prime Video starting at the beginning of the 2022 NFL season. The NFL and Amazon were originally going to start airing games at the beginning of 2023 season, but both companies have agreed to start one year earlier making the 2021 season the last year airing Thursday night games on Fox News.

item.title: Which Minnesota Vikings Wide Receiver Had the Best Rookie Season?
item.description: If you are as big as a Minnesota Vikings fan as I am, you would know that the Vikings have had their fair share of talented wide receivers in the past. From Hall of Famer Cris Carter to Justin Jefferson who is entering his second season in the league. For this project I wanted to look at three different Viking receivers and compare who each of their rookie seasons by looking at three main statistics: receptions, receiving yards, and touchdowns.

item.title: Are the New England Patriots more of a passing threat with Cam Newton or Tom Brady?
item.description: All good things must come to an end, and that is what happened in the summer going into the 2020 NFL season with the New England Patriots quarterback for the past two decades, Tom Brady. After 20 seasons with the Patriots, Brady was able to give the city of New England six Super Bowl Championships, 13 AFC Championship games, while winning three the NFL MVP awards and Super Bowl MVP three times.
